usually without serious injury; to make somebody/something fall in this way</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">He slipped and tumbled down the stairs.</span></span></span></span></li><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#6895c306afac42348be5637913a326c2" class="sen"></a><span class="num">2</span><span class="gram-g"><span dramatic way</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The scaffolding came tumbling down.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="label-g"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="reg">figurative</span><span class="wrap">)</span></span> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">World records tumbled at the last Olympics.</span></span></span></span> is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Middle English</span></span> (as a verb, also in the sense <span class="qt">‘dance with contortions’</span>): from <span class="lang">Middle Low German</span> <span class="ff">tummelen</span>; compare with <span class="def"><span class="lang">Old English</span></span> <span class="etym_i">tumbian</span> <span class="qt">‘to dance’</span>. The sense was probably influenced by <span class="lang">Old French</span> <span class="ff">tomber</span> ‘to fall’. The noun, first in the sense <span class="qt">‘tangled mass’</span>, dates from the mid 17th cent.</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span billion.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">She tumbled through the front door and collapsed in a heap.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The news sent shares tumbling.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The river tumbled over boulders.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">They all tumbled out of the minibus.</span></span><span &nbsp; </a></span> </div> <div class="clear"> &nbsp; </div> <br> </div> </div> <span class="sn-gs"><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#6895c306afac42348be5637913a326c2" class="sen"></a><span class="num">1</span><span class="gram-g"><span class="wrap">[</span><span class="gram">countable</span><span class="sep">,</span> <span class="gram">usually singular</span><span class="wrap">]</span></span> <span class="def">a sudden fall</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The jockey <span class="cl"><strong>took a nasty tumble</strong></span> at the third fence.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Share prices <span class="cl"><strong>took a sharp tumble</strong></span> following news of the merger.</span></span></span></span> <span class="xr-gs"><span class="prefix">see also</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://rough and tumble" otitle="rough and tumble definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">rough and tumble</span></span></a></span></li><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#6895c306afac42348be5637913a326c2" class="sen"></a><span class="num">2</span><span class="def">an untidy group of things</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">a tumble of blond curls</span></span></span></li></span> <span class="res-g"><span class="collapse" otitle="Word Origin"><span class="unbox is-active"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Middle English</span></span> (as a verb, also in the sense <span class="qt">‘dance with contortions’</span>): from <span class="lang">Middle Low German</span> <span class="ff">tummelen</span>; compare with <span class="def"><span class="lang">Old English</span></span> <span class="etym_i">tumbian</span> <span class="qt">‘to dance’</span>. The sense was probably influenced by <span class="lang">Old French</span> <span class="ff">tomber</span> ‘to fall’. The noun, first in the sense <span class="qt">‘tangled mass’</span>, dates from the mid 17th cent.</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Extra examples</span><span class="body"><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Her hair fell in a golden tumble around her shoulders.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Share prices took a tumble following the election.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">an untidy tumble of buildings</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Share prices took a tumble following news of the merger.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span> </ol> </div></div></html>

(originally meaning to appoint someone to a position): from <span class="lang">Latin</span> <span class="ff">institut-</span> ‘established’, from the verb <span class="ff">instituere</span>, from <span class="ff">in-</span> ‘in, towards’ + <span class="ff">statuere</span> ‘set up’. The noun is from <span class="lang">Latin</span> <span class="ff">institutum</span> ‘something designed, precept’, neuter past participle of <span class="ff">instituere</span>; the current sense dates coma	Getting economies in medically induced comas back on their feet is a circumstance tailor-made for investment in climate-friendly infrastructure that boosts growth and creates new jobs.	<html><style type="text/css">*{word-wrap:break-word !important}body{color:#000;font-family:"Lucida Grande","Open Sans","Lucida Sans Unicode","sans-serif";font-size:100%;line-height:1.2em}a{color:#36f;text-decoration:none}a:hover{text-decoration:underline}.webtop-g .sound,.top-g .sound,.ei-g .sound,.if-g .sound,.pron__wrap .sound{vertical-align:middle;display:inline-block}.webtop-g .pron-uk,.top-g .pron-uk,.ei-g .pron-uk,.if-g .pron-uk,.pron__wrap back on their feet	Getting economies in medically induced comas back on their feet is a circumstance tailor-made for investment in climate-friendly infrastructure that boosts growth and creates new jobs.	can not find definitions
drop	The International Energy Agency expects global industrial greenhouse-gas emissions to be about 8% lower in 2020 than they were in 2019, the largest annual drop since the second world drop</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Language Bank"><span class="unbox"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Language Bank</span><span class="body"><span class="h1">fall</span><span class="h2">Describing a year.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">Car crime <span class="eb">fell</span> by about a quarter over a 12-month period.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">The number of stolen vehicles <span class="eb">dropped</span> from 1 013 to 780, <span class="eb">a fall of</span> 26 per cent.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">According to this data, 780 vehicles were stolen, 26% <span class="eb">down</span> on the previous year.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">There was an 11% <span class="eb">drop</span> in reported thefts from motor vehicles, from 1 971 to 1 737.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">These figures show that, as far as car crime is concerned, <span class="eb">the main trend is downwards</span>.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> </li></span> <span class="sn-gs"> <span class="shcut">distance</span><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#28fbc65f3d8245d48b863eedfbe31961" class="sen"></a><span class="num">4</span><span class="gram-g"><span class="wrap">[</span><span class="gram">singular</span><span class="wrap">]</span></span> <span class="def">a distance down from a high point to a lower point</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">There was a sheer drop of fifty metres to the rocks below.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">a twenty-foot drop</span></span></span></li></span> <span class="sn-gs"> <span class="shcut">medicine</span><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#28fbc65f3d8245d48b863eedfbe31961" class="sen"></a><span class="num">5</span><span class="v-gs" type="alt"><span class="v-g"><span class="v"><strong>drops</strong></span></span></span> <span class="gram-g"><span class="wrap">[</span><span class="gram">plural</span><span class="wrap">]</span></span> <span class="def">a liquid medicine that you put one drop at a time into your eyes, ears or nose</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">eye drops</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Use the drops three times a day.</span></span></span></span></li></span> <span class="sn-gs"> <span class="shcut">delivering</span><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#28fbc65f3d8245d48b863eedfbe31961" class="sen"></a><span class="num">6</span><span class="gram-g"><span class="wrap">[</span><span class="gram">countable</span><span class="wrap">]</span></span> <span class="def">the act of delivering somebody/something in a vehicle or by plane; the act of dropping something</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Aid agencies are organizing food drops to civilians in the war zone.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">a parachute drop</span></span></span> </li></span> <span class="sn-gs"> <span class="shcut">sweet/candy</span><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#28fbc65f3d8245d48b863eedfbe31961" class="sen"></a><span class="num">7</span><span class="gram-g"><span class="wrap">[</span><span class="gram">countable</span><span class="wrap">]</span></span> <span class="def">a small round sweet/candy of the type mentioned</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">fruit drops</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">cough drops <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> sweets/candy to help a cough<span class="wrap">)</span></span></span></span></span> </li></span> <span class="res-g"><span class="collapse" otitle="Word Origin"><span class="unbox is-active"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Old English</span></span> <span class="etym_i">dropa</span> (noun), <span class="etym_i">droppian</span> (verb), of <span class="lang">Germanic</span> origin; related to <span class="lang">German</span> <span class="ff">Tropfen</span> ‘a drop’, <span class="ff">tropfen</span> ‘to drip’, also to <span class="xr"><span class="xh">drip</span></span> and <span class="xr"><span class="xh">droop</span></span>.</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Extra examples</span><span class="body"><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Great drops of rain started to fall.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Large drops of sweat rolled down her face.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">She wiped a drop of water from her chin.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The cliff plunged in a sheer drop down to the beach.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The glut of coffee led to a sharp drop in prices.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The restaurant has suffered a big drop in trade.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Tiny drops of sweat appeared on her forehead.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">We mustn’t waste a single drop.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">A few drops of rain fell.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Can I have a drop more milk in my coffee, please?</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He drained the last few drops from his glass.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">I haven’t touched a drop all evening.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">There was a drop of blood on her shirt.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">There was a twenty-foot drop onto the stones beneath.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">We were inches away from a sheer drop to the crashing waves below.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">a fall/​drop of 30%</span></span></span></span></span></span></span> <span class="idm-gs"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else of a hat</span> <div class="clear"> &nbsp; </div> <br> </div> </div><span class="sn-gs"><span class="sn-g"><span class="def">immediately; without hesitating</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The company can't expect me to move my home and family at the drop of a hat.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span> <span class="idm-g"> <div of money raised was a drop in the ocean compared to what we needed.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> </ol> </div></div></html>
forecast	As is more likely now, help lower government debts, which are already forecast to reach an average 122% of GDP in the rich world this year, and will rise further if green investments are <div class="top-container"> <div class="top-g"> <div class="webtop-g"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a> <span class="z">&nbsp;</span> <h2 class="h">forecast</h2> <span class="z">&nbsp;</span> <a id="74c167e46f734dc2aee2b3491b6ab5c1"></a><a href="entry://#da84f1e5b0c54beab0c9f9e8ec475d5f" class="to-top"><span class="pos">noun</span></a> </div> <span class="pos-g"><span class="pos">noun</span></span> <div class="pron-gs ei-g"> <span class="pron-g" geo="br"><span class="prefix">BrE</span> <span class="phon"><span class="bre">BrE</span><span class="separator">/</span><span class="wrap">/</span>ˈfɔːkɑːst<span class="wrap">/</span><span class="separator">/</span></span> <a class="sound audio_play_button pron-uk icon-audio" otitle=" pronunciation English" href="sound://media/english/uk_pron/f/for/forec/forecast__gb_1.mp3" type="sound"> &nbsp; </a></span> <span class="sep">;</span> <span class="pron-g" geo="n_am"><span class="prefix">NAmE</span> <span class="phon"><span class="name">NAmE</span><span class="separator">/</span><span class="wrap">/</span>ˈfɔːrkæst<span class="wrap">/</span><span type="sound"> &nbsp; </a></span> </div> <span class="res-g" hide="y"> <span class="xr-gs"><a class="Ref" href="/topic/running_a_business/forecast_1" otitle="Topic Running a business"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">Running a business</span></span></a></span></span> <div class="clear"> &nbsp; </div> <br> </div> </div> <span class="sn-gs"><span class="sn-g" ox3000="y"><span class="sym_first"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a></span><span class="def">a statement about what will happen in the future, based on information that is available now</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">sales forecasts</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">It is difficult to make long-term forecasts for a fast-growing industry.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The forecast said there would be sunny intervals and showers.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The shipping forecast gave warnings of gales.</span></span></span></span> <span class="xr-gs"><span class="prefix">see also</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://weather forecast" otitle="weather forecast definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">weather forecast</span></span></a></span> </span></span> <span class="res-g"><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox <span class="sn-gs"><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#20895a2c1e074af8a0b2715857b5828f" class="sen"></a><span class="num">1</span><span class="def">a long strip of land, especially one on which the plants or crops have been cut</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The combine had cut a swathe around the edge of the field.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Development has affected vast swathes of our countryside.</span></span></span></span></li><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#20895a2c1e074af8a0b2715857b5828f" class="sen"></a><span class="num">2</span><span class="def">a large strip or area of something</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The mountains rose above a swathe of thick cloud.</span></span></span></span></li></span> <span class="res-g"><span class="collapse" otitle="Word Origin"><span class="unbox is-active"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"><span class="pos">noun</span> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Old English</span></span> <span class="etym_i">swæth</span>, <span class="etym_i">swathu</span> <span class="qt">‘track, trace’</span>, of <span class="lang">West Germanic</span> origin; related to <span class="lang">Dutch</span> <span class="ff">zwad(e)</span> and <span class="lang">German</span> <span class="ff">Schwade</span>. In <span class="def"><span class="lang">Middle English</span></span> the term denoted a measure of the width of grassland, probably reckoned by a sweep of the mower's scythe.</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Extra examples</span><span class="body"><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The Great Plains of the US cover a vast swathe of land.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The front door was open and a swathe of sunlight lay across the floor.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The rainforest forms a swathe of jungle in West Africa.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The war had cut a swathe of destruction across northern France.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span> <span class="idm-gs"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Idioms</span> <span class="idm-g"> <div class="top-container"> <div class="top-g"> <span class="idm">cut a swathe through something</span> <div class="clear"> &nbsp; emissions	Shutting down swathes of the economy has led to huge cuts in greenhouse-gas emissions.	can not find definitions

immature	In the past it was possible to argue that, although prices may entrench an advantage for cleaner gas over dirtier coal, renewable technologies were too immature to benefit.	<html><style href="entry://#9e561bd71c7546b7886f432cf6fece6e" class="sen"></a><span class="num">1 </span><span class="sym_first"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a></span><span class="gram-g"><span class="wrap">[</span><span class="gram">singular</span><span class="sep">,</span> <span class="gram">uncountable</span><span class="wrap">]</span></span> <span class="def">the size or extent of something, especially when compared with something else</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">They entertain <span class="cl"><strong>on a large scale</strong></span> <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> they hold expensive parties with a lot of guests<span class="wrap">)</span></span>.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Here was corruption <span class="cl"><strong>on a grand scale</strong></span>.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">On a global scale, 77% of energy is created from fossil fuels.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">to achieve <span class="cl"><strong>economies of scale</strong></span> in production <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> to produce many items so the cost of producing each one is reduced<span class="wrap">)</span></span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">scale</span> of something</span> <span class="rx-g"><span until morning that <span class="cl"><strong>the sheer scale</strong></span> of the damage could be seen <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> how great it was<span class="res-g"><span class="collapse" otitle="Word Origin"><span class="unbox is-active"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"><span class="pos">noun</span> <span class="sense">senses 1 to 4</span><span class="z"> and </span><span class="pos">noun</span> <span class="sense">senses 6 to 7</span> <span class="def"><span class="lang">late Middle English</span></span>: from <span class="lang">Latin</span> <span class="ff">scala</span> ‘ladder’ (the verb via <span class="lang">Old French</span> <span class="ff">escaler</span> or <span class="lang">medieval Latin</span> <span class="ff">scalare</span> ‘climb’), from the base of <span class="lang">Latin</span> <span class="ff">scandere</span> ‘to climb’. <span class="pos">noun</span> <span class="sense">sense 5</span> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Middle English</span></span> (in the sense <span class="qt">‘drinking cup’</span>, surviving in <span class="lang">South African English</span>): from <span class="lang">Old Norse</span> <span class="ff">skál</span> ‘bowl’, of <span class="lang">Germanic</span> origin; related to <span class="lang">Dutch</span> <span class="ff">schaal</span>, <span class="lang">German</span> <span class="ff">Schale</span> ‘bowl’, also to <span class="lang">English</span> dialect <span class="etym_i">shale</span> <span class="qt">‘dish’</span>. <span class="pos">noun</span> <span class="sense">senses 8 to 10</span> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Middle English</span></span>: shortening of <span class="lang">Old French</span> <span class="ff">escale</span>, from the <span class="lang">Germanic</span> base of <span class="xr"><span class="xh">scale</span></span> (noun - sense 5).</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox Middle English</span></span>: from <span class="lang">Latin</span> <span class="ff">scala</span> ‘ladder’ (the verb via <span class="lang">Old French</span> <span class="ff">escaler</span> or <span class="lang">medieval Latin</span> <span class="ff">scalare</span> ‘climb’), from the base of <span class="lang">Latin</span> <span class="ff">scandere</span> ‘to climb’. <span class="pos">verb</span> <span class="sense">senses 2 to 3</span> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Middle English</span></span>: shortening of <span class="lang">Old French</span> <span class="ff">escale</span>, from the <span class="lang">Germanic</span> base of <span class="xr"><span class="xh">scale</span></span> (noun - sense 5).</span></span></span></span> <span class="pv-gs" type="xref"><span class="xr-gs"><span </div> <span class="sn-gs"><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#f06d5a5af1344beb94c381d0ba6a55b7" class="sen"></a><span class="num">1</span><span class="dis-g"><span class="wrap">(</span><span earned a precarious living as an artist.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The museum is in a financially precarious position.</span></span></span><span class="x">The path down to the beach is very precarious in wet weather.</span></span></span></span></li></span> <span class="res-g"><span class="collapse" otitle="Word Origin"><span class="unbox is-active"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"> <span class="def">mid 17th cent.</span>: from <span class="lang">Latin</span> <span class="ff">precarius</span> ‘obtained by entreaty’ (from <span class="ff">prex</span>, <span class="ff">prec-</span> ‘prayer’) + <span class="xr"><span class="xh">-ous</span></span>.</span></span></span></span> </ol> long	Disasters long talked about, and long ignored, can come upon you with no warning, turning life inside out and shaking all that seemed stable.	<html><style type="text/css">*{word-wrap:break-word dark hair.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">He walked down the long corridor.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">It was definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">short</span></span></a></span></li><li class="sn-g" ox3000="y"><a href="entry://#9c7e779115c743a48b6151b889131997" class="sen"></a><span class="num">2 is six feet long.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The report is only three pages long.</span></span></span></span></li></span> <span class="sn-gs"> <span class="shcut">time</span><li class="sn-g" ox3000="y"><a href="entry://#9c7e779115c743a48b6151b889131997" class="sen"></a><span class="num">3 </span><span class="sym_first"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a></span><span class="def">lasting or taking a great amount of time or more time than usual</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">He’s been ill <span class="cl"><strong>(for) a long time</strong></span>.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">There was a long silence before she stays light for more time each day<span class="wrap">)</span></span>.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">a <span class="cl"><strong>long book/film/list</strong></span> <span than is usual<span class="wrap">)</span></span>.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="label-g"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="geo" geo="n_am">North American English</span><span class="wrap">)</span></span> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">He stared at them <span class="cl"><strong>for the longest time</strong></span> <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> for a very long time<span class="wrap">)</span></span> before answering.</span></span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Which Word?"><span class="unbox"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Which Word?</span><span class="body"><span class="h1">(for) long / (for) a long time</span><span class="bullet"><span class="li"> Both <span class="eb">(for) long</span> and <span class="eb">(for) a long time</span> are used as expressions of time. In positive sentences <span class="eb">(for) a long time</span> is used:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">We’ve been friends a long time.</span></span></span></span> <span class="eb">(For) long</span> is not used in positive sentences unless it is used with <span class="ei">too</span>, <span class="ei">enough</span>, <span class="ei">as</span>, <span class="ei">so</span>, <span class="ei">seldom</span>, etc:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">I stayed out in the sun for too long.</span></span></span> <span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">You’ve been waiting long enough.</span></span></span></span> Both <span class="eb">(for) long</span> and <span class="eb">(for) a long time</span> can be used in questions, but <span class="eb">(for) long</span> is usually preferred:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Have you been waiting long?</span></span></span></span></span><span class="li"> In negative sentences <span class="eb">(for) a long time</span> sometimes has a different meaning from <span class="eb">(for) long</span>. Compare:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">I haven’t been here for a long time <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> It is a long time since the last time I was here<span class="wrap">)</span></span> <span class="er">and</span> I haven’t been here long <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> I arrived here only a short time ago<span class="wrap">)</span></span></span></span></span>.</span></span></span></span></span> <span class="xr-gs"><span class="prefix">opposite</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://short" otitle="short definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">short</span></span></a></span></li><li class="sn-g" ox3000="y"><a href="entry://#9c7e779115c743a48b6151b889131997" class="sen"></a><span class="num">4 </span><span class="sym_first"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a></span><span class="def">used for asking or talking about particular periods of time</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x"><span class="cl"><strong>How long</strong></span> is the course?</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">I think it's only three weeks long.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">How long a stay did you have in mind?</span></span></span></span></li><li class="sn-g" ox3000="y"><a href="entry://#9c7e779115c743a48b6151b889131997" class="sen"></a><span class="num">5 </span><span class="sym_first"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a></span><span class="def">seeming to last or take more time than it really does because, for example, you are very busy or not happy</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">I'm tired. It's been a long day.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">We were married for ten long years.</span></span></span></span> <span class="xr-gs"><span class="prefix">opposite</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://short" otitle="short definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">short</span></span></a></span></li></span> <span class="sn-gs"> <span class="shcut">clothes</span><li class="sn-g" ox3000="y"><a href="entry://#9c7e779115c743a48b6151b889131997" class="sen"></a><span class="num">6 </span><span class="sym_first"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a></span><span class="def">covering all or most of your legs or arms</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">She usually wears long skirts.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">a long-sleeved shirt</span></span></span> <span class="xr-gs"><span class="prefix">opposite</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://short" otitle="short definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">short</span></span></a></span></li></span> <span class="sn-gs"> <span class="shcut">vowel sounds</span><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#9c7e779115c743a48b6151b889131997" class="sen"></a><span class="num">7</span> <span class="label-g"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="subj">phonetics</span><span class="wrap">)</span></span> <span class="def">taking more time to make than a short vowel sound in the same position</span> <span class="xr-gs"><span class="prefix">opposite</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://short" otitle="short definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">short</span></span></a></span></li></span> <span class="res-g"><span class="collapse" otitle="Word Family"><span class="wfw-g"><span class="wfw">long</span> <span class="wfp">adjective</span> <span class="wfp">adverb</span></span><span class="wfw-g"><span class="wfw">length</span> <span class="wfp">noun</span></span><span class="wfw-g"><span class="wfw">lengthy</span> <span class="wfp">adjective</span></span><span class="wfw-g"><span class="wfw">lengthen</span> <span class="wfp">verb</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Word Origin"><span class="unbox is-active"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"><span class="pos">adjective</span> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Old English</span></span> <span class="ff">lang</span>, <span class="ff">long</span> (adjective), <span class="ff">lange</span>, <span class="ff">longe</span> (adverb), of <span class="lang">Germanic</span> origin; related to <span class="lang">Dutch</span> and <span class="lang">German</span> <span class="ff">lang</span>.</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Extra examples</span><span class="body"><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">At 900 pages, the book is overly long.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Economy class can be uncomfortable for those with extra-long legs.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">His drive to work is fairly long.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">My hair had grown long.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">That dress looks a bit long to me.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">a pair of impossibly long legs</span></span><span class="x-g"> It’s been a long day.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">It took me a long time to accept the situation.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Nurses have to work long hours.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">a long book/​film/​list</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">a long corridor/​bridge</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">long hair</span></span></span></span></span></span></span> <span class="idm-gs"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Idioms</span> <span class="idm-g"> <div class="top-container"> <div class="top-g"> <span class="idm">as long as your arm</span> <div class="clear"> &nbsp; </div> <br> </div> </div><span class="sn-gs"><span class="sn-g"><span class="def">to consider what is likely to happen or be important over a long period of time rather than only considering the present situation</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">As pension funds are investing for members’ retirements, they can take the long view.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span> <span class="idm-g"> <div class="top-container"> <div class="top-g"> <span class="idm">to cut a long story short</span> <span class="label-g"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="geo" geo="br">British English</span><span class="wrap">)</span></span> <span class="v-gs" type="vf"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="v-g"><span class="label-g"><span class="geo" geo="n_am">North American English</span></span> <span class="v"><strong>to make a long story short</strong></span></span><span class="wrap">)</span></span> <div class="clear"> &nbsp; </div> <br> </div> </div><span class="sn-gs"><span class="sn-g"><span class="label-g"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="reg">informal</span><span class="wrap">)</span></span> <span class="def">used when you are saying that you will get to the point of what you are saying quickly, without including all the details</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">To cut a long story short, we didn’t get home until 3 in the morning!</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> </ol> </div><div class="entry"> <ol class="h-g"> <div class="top-container"> <div class="top-g"> <div class="webtop-g"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a> <span class="z">&nbsp;</span> <h2 class="h">long</h2> <span class="z">&nbsp;</span> <a id="bf9a63def4854b218a3a57ca92d95712"></a><a href="entry://#9c7e779115c743a48b6151b889131997" class="to-top"><span class="pos">adverb</span></a> </div> <span class="pos-g"><span class="pos">adverb</span></span> <div class="pron-gs ei-g"> <span class="pron-g" geo="br"><span class="prefix">BrE</span> <span class="phon"><span class="bre">BrE</span><span class="separator">/</span><span class="wrap">/</span>lɒŋ<span class="wrap">/</span><span class="separator">/</span></span> <a class="sound audio_play_button pron-uk icon-audio" otitle=" pronunciation English" href="sound://media/english/uk_pron/l/lon/long_/long__gb_1.mp3" type="sound"> &nbsp; </a></span> <span class="sep">,</span> <span class="pron-g" geo="n_am"><span class="phon"><span class="name">NAmE</span><span class="separator">/</span><span class="wrap">/</span><span class="ptl">ˈlɑːŋ</span>ɡɪst<span class="wrap">/</span><span class="separator">/</span></span> <a class="sound audio_play_button pron-us icon-audio" otitle=" pronunciation American" href="sound://media/english/us_pron/l/lon/longe/longest__us_3.mp3" type="sound"> &nbsp; </a></span> </div></span><span class="wrap">)</span></span> <div class="clear"> &nbsp; </div> <br> </div> </div> <span class="sn-gs"><li class="sn-g" ox3000="y"><a href="entry://#9c7e779115c743a48b6151b889131997" class="sen"></a><span class="num">1 </span><span class="sym_first"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a></span><span class="def">for a long time</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Have you been here long?</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Stay as long as you like.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The party went on long into the night.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">This may <span class="cl"><strong>take longer</strong></span> than we thought.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">I won't <span class="cl"><strong>be long</strong></span> <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> I'll return, be ready, etc. soon<span class="wrap">)</span></span>.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x"><span class="cl"><strong>How long</strong></span> have you been waiting?</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">These reforms are long overdue.</span></span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Which Word?"><span class="unbox"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Which Word?</span><span class="body"><span class="h1">(for) long / (for) a long time</span><span class="bullet"><span class="li"> Both <span class="eb">(for) long</span> and <span class="eb">(for) a long time</span> are used as expressions of time. In positive sentences <span class="eb">(for) a long time</span> is used:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">We’ve been friends a long time.</span></span></span></span> <span class="eb">(For) long</span> is not used in positive sentences unless it is used with <span class="ei">too</span>, <span class="ei">enough</span>, <span class="ei">as</span>, <span class="ei">so</span>, <span class="ei">seldom</span>, etc:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">I stayed out in the sun for too long.</span></span></span> <span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">You’ve been waiting long enough.</span></span></span></span> Both <span class="eb">(for) long</span> and <span class="eb">(for) a long time</span> can be used in questions, but <span class="eb">(for) long</span> is usually preferred:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Have you been waiting long?</span></span></span></span></span><span class="li"> In negative sentences <span class="eb">(for) a long time</span> sometimes has a different meaning from <span class="eb">(for) long</span>. Compare:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">I haven’t been here for a long time <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> It is a long time since the last time I was here<span class="wrap">)</span></span> <span class="er">and</span> I haven’t been here long <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> I arrived here only a short time ago<span class="wrap">)</span></span>.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></li><li class="sn-g" ox3000="y"><a href="entry://#9c7e779115c743a48b6151b889131997" class="sen"></a><span class="num">2 </span><span class="sym_first"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a></span><span class="def">a long time before or after a particular time or event</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">He retired long before the war.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">It wasn't long before she had persuaded him <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> it only took a short time<span class="wrap">)</span></span>.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">We'll be home <span class="cl"><strong>before long</strong></span> <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> soon<span class="wrap">)</span></span>.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The house was pulled down <span class="cl"><strong>long ago</strong></span>.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">They had <span class="cl"><strong>long since</strong></span> <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> a long time before the present time<span class="wrap">)</span></span> moved away.</span></span></span></span></li><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#9c7e779115c743a48b6151b889131997" class="sen"></a><span class="num">3</span><span class="def">used after a noun to emphasize that something happens for the whole of a particular period of time</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">We had to wait <span class="cl"><strong>all day long</strong></span>.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The baby was crying <span class="cl"><strong>all night long</strong></span>.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">They stayed up <span class="cl"><strong>the whole night long</strong></span>.</span></span></span></span></li></span> <span class="res-g"><span class="collapse" otitle="Word Family"><span class="wfw-g"><span class="wfw">long</span> <span class="wfp">adjective</span> <span class="wfp">adverb</span></span><span class="wfw-g"><span class="wfw">length</span> <span class="wfp">noun</span></span><span class="wfw-g"><span class="wfw">lengthy</span> <span class="wfp">adjective</span></span><span class="wfw-g"><span class="wfw">lengthen</span> <span class="wfp">verb</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Word Origin"><span class="unbox is-active"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else class="lang">Germanic</span> origin; related to <span class="lang">Dutch</span> and <span class="lang">German</span> <span class="ff">lang</span>.</span></span></span></span> <span underpin	By itself, it is unlikely to create a network of electric-vehicle charging-points, more nuclear power plants to underpin the cheap but intermittent electricity supplied by renewables, programmes to retrofit inefficient buildings and to develop new technologies aimed at reducing emissions that cannot simply be electrified away, such as those from large aircraft and some farms.	<html><style type="text/css">*{word-wrap:break-word !important}body{color:#000;font-family:"Lucida Grande","Open Sans","Lucida Sans class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The report is underpinned by extensive research.</span></span></span></span></li><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#b5b5ba49b4314d318553a34eb35b9a1f" class="sen"></a><span class="num">2</span><span class="cf"><span class="exp">underpin</span> something</span> <span class="label-g"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="reg">specialist</span><span class="wrap">)</span></span> <span class="def">to support a wall by putting metal, concrete, etc. under it</span></li></span> </ol> </div></div></html>
intermittent	By itself, it is unlikely to create a network of electric-vehicle charging-points, more nuclear power plants to underpin the cheap but intermittent electricity supplied by renewables, programmes to retrofit inefficient buildings and to develop new technologies aimed at reducing emissions that cannot simply be electrified away, such as those from large aircraft and some farms.	<html><style type="text/css">*{word-wrap:break-word !important}body{color:#000;font-family:"Lucida Grande","Open Sans","Lucida Sans Origin</span><span class="body"><span class="pos">noun</span> <span class="sense">senses 1 to 4</span> <span class="def"><span class="lang">late Middle English</span></span> (as a plural noun denoting fragments of uneaten food): from <span class="lang">Old Norse</span> <span class="ff">skrap</span> ‘scraps’; related to <span class="ff">skrapa</span> ‘to scrape’. The verb dates from the late 19th cent. <span class="pos">noun</span> <span class="sense">sense 5</span> <span class="def">late 17th cent.</span> (as a noun in the sense <span class="qt">‘sinister plot, scheme’</span>): perhaps from the noun <span class="xr"><span class="xh">scrape</span></span>.</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Extra examples</span><span class="body"><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He ate every last scrap of the food.</span></span><span class="x">He removed the last scraps of food from his plate.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">My first computer has been consigned to the scrap heap.</span></span><span class="x-g"> is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"><span class="pos">verb</span> <span class="sense">sense 1</span> <span class="def"><span class="lang">late Middle English</span></span> (as a plural noun denoting fragments of uneaten food): from <span class="lang">Old Norse</span> <span class="ff">skrap</span> ‘scraps’; related to <span class="ff">skrapa</span> ‘to scrape’. The verb dates from the late 19th cent. <span class="pos">verb</span> <span class="sense">sense 2</span> <span class="def">late 17th cent.</span> (as a noun in the sense <span class="qt">‘sinister plot, scheme’</span>): perhaps from the noun <span class="xr"><span class="xh">scrape</span></span>.</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Extra examples</span><span class="body"><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Around 40 managerial positions are to be scrapped in a major shake-up of the company.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The government has been forced to scrap plans for a proposed tax reform.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The oldest of the aircraft should be scrapped.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The worst cars in the fleet were scrapped first.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span> </ol> </div></div></html>

tip	The timing is paricularly propitious because such prices have the most immediate effects when they tip the balance between two already available technologies.	<html><style Origin</span><span class="body"><span class="pos">noun</span> <span class="sense">senses 1 to 2</span> <span class="def"><span class="lang">late Middle English</span></span>: from <span class="lang">Old Norse</span> <span class="ff">typpi</span> (noun), <span class="ff">typpa</span> (verb), <span class="ff">typptr</span> ‘tipped’; related to the noun <span class="xr"><span class="xh">top</span></span>. <span class="pos">noun</span> <span class="sense">senses 3 to 5</span> <span class="def"><span class="lang">late Middle English</span></span>: perhaps of <span class="lang">Scandinavian</span> origin, influenced later by <span class="xr"><span class="xh">tip</span></span> in the sense <span class="qt">‘touch with a tip or point’</span>. Current senses of the noun date from the mid 19th cent. <span class="pos">noun</span> <span class="sense">senses 6 to 7</span> <span class="def">early 17th cent.</span> (in the sense <span class="qt">‘give, hand, pass’</span>): probably from <span class="xr"><span class="xh">tip</span></span> <span class="qt">‘thin pointed end of something’</span>.</span></span></span><span <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"><span class="pos">verb</span> <span class="sense">senses 1 to 4</span> <span class="def"><span class="lang">late Middle English</span></span>: perhaps of <span class="lang">Scandinavian</span> origin, influenced later by <span class="xr"><span class="xh">tip</span></span> in the sense <span class="qt">‘touch with a tip or point’</span>. Current senses of the noun date from the mid 19th cent. <span class="pos">verb</span> <span class="sense">senses 5 to 6</span> <span class="def">early 17th cent.</span> (in the sense <span class="qt">‘give, hand, pass’</span>): probably from <span class="xr"><span class="xh">tip</span></span> <span class="qt">‘thin pointed end of something’</span>. <span class="pos">verb</span> <span class="sense">sense 7</span> <span class="def"><span class="lang">late Middle English</span></span>: from <span class="lang">Old Norse</span> <span class="ff">typpi</span> (noun), <span class="ff">typpa</span> (verb), <span class="ff">typptr</span> ‘tipped’; related to the noun <span class="xr"><span class="xh">top</span></span>.</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Extra examples</span><span class="body"><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He has been widely tipped as a future CEO.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The band is being hotly tipped for the top.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The senator has been widely tipped as a future president.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">His hat was tipped over his forehead.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Suddenly the boat tipped to one side.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">While trying to sit down, I tipped the tray and my entire dinner went onto the rug.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span> <span class="idm-gs"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Idioms</span> <span class="idm-g"> <div class="top-container"> <div class="top-g"> <span class="idm-l"><span class="idm">I take my hat off to somebody</span><span class="sep">,</span> <span class="idm">hats off to somebody</span></span> <span class="label-g"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="geo" geo="br">both especially British English</span><span class="wrap">)</span></span> <span class="v-gs" type="vf"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="v-g"><span class="label-g"><span class="geo" geo="n_am">usually North American English</span></span> <span class="v"><strong>I tip my hat to somebody</strong></span></span><span class="wrap">)</span></span> <div class="clear"> &nbsp; </div></span></span></span></span> <div class="clear"> &nbsp; </div> <br> </div> </div> <span class="sn-gs"><li class="sn-g" ox3000="y"><a href="entry://#5df6a53689e243f382099500d2dc1fb9" class="sen"></a><span class="num">1 </span><span class="sym_first"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a></span><span class="def">to make something known to somebody</span> <span class="xr-gs"><span class="prefix">synonym</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://disclose" otitle="disclose definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">disclose</span></span></a></span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">reveal</span> something (to somebody)</span> <span class="x">to reveal a secret</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Details of the murder were revealed by the local paper.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The doctors did not reveal the truth to him.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Salted peanuts were recently revealed as the nation’s favourite snack.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Her expression revealed nothing.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">reveal</span> (that)…</span> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The report reveals (that) the company made a loss of £20 million last year.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="cf">it is revealed that…</span> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">It was revealed that important evidence had been suppressed.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">reveal</span> how, what, etc…</span> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Officers could not reveal how he died.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">reveal</span> somebody/something to be/have something</span> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Salted peanuts were recently revealed to be the nation's favourite snack.</span></span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Language Bank"><span class="unbox"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Language Bank</span><span class="body"><span class="h1">evidence</span><span class="h2">Giving proof</span><span class="bullet"><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x"><span class="eb">There is clear evidence that</span> TV advertising influences what children buy.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x"><span class="eb">It is clear</span> from numerous studies <span class="eb">that</span> TV advertising influences what children buy.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">Recent research <span class="eb">demonstrates</span> that TV advertising influences children’s spending habits.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">Many parents think that TV advertising influences their children. This view <span class="eb">is supported by</span> the findings of a recent study, which <span class="eb">show</span> a clear link between television advertisements and children’s spending habits.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">The findings also <span class="eb">reveal</span> that most children are unaware of the persuasive purpose of advertising.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x"><span class="eb">There is little evidence that</span> children understand the persuasive intent of advertising.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">The results <span class="eb">contradict</span> claims that advertising is unrelated to children’s spending habits.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">Manufacturers argue that it is difficult to <span class="eb">prove</span> that advertising alone influences what children buy.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></li><li class="sn-g" ox3000="y"><a href="entry://#5df6a53689e243f382099500d2dc1fb9" class="sen"></a><span class="num">2 </span><span class="sym_first"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a></span><span class="def">to show something that previously could not be seen</span> <span class="xr-gs"><span class="prefix">synonym</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://display" otitle="display definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">display</span></span></a></span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">reveal</span> something</span> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">He laughed, revealing a line of white teeth.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The door opened to reveal a cosy little room.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">X-rays revealed a fracture.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">reveal</span> yourself</span> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">She crouched in the dark, too frightened to reveal herself.</span></span></span></span></li> <span class="xr-gs"><span class="prefix">see also</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://revelation" otitle="revelation definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">revelation</span></span></a><span class="sep">,</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://revelatory" otitle="revelatory definition"><span <span class="xs"><span class="wrap">(</span>2<span class="wrap">)</span></span></span></a></span></span> <span class="res-g"><span class="collapse" otitle="Word Origin"><span class="unbox is-active"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"> <span class="def"><span class="lang">late Middle English</span></span>: from <span class="lang">Old French</span> <span class="ff">reveler</span> or <span class="lang">Latin</span> <span class="ff">revelare</span>, from <span class="ff">re-</span> ‘again’ (expressing reversal) + <span class="ff">velum</span> ‘veil’.</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Extra examples</span><span class="body"><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">A thorough search failed to reveal the murder weapon.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He has been revealed as a traitor.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">I’m afraid I cannot reveal any more details at the moment.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">She refused to reveal the whereabouts of her husband.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">She would not reveal her true identity to the police.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The door swung open to reveal a tall, gaunt figure.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">One of the oldest people in Britain has revealed her secret: a drop of brandy in her tea.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Salted peanuts were recently revealed as the nation’s favourite snack.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span> </ol> </div></div></html>
crucial	That drop reveals a crucial truth about the climate crisis.	<html><style type="text/css">*{word-wrap:break-word !important}body{color:#000;font-family:"Lucida Grande","Open Sans","Lucida Sans rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="OALD9EnEn.css"><a id="33c23168dfa54ac9a7c2c8696a777625"></a><div class="dict-top"><a href="entry://#5172a69d31db4437b25d5c8bc0460d90" class="to-pos"><span class="pos">adjective</span></a></div><div class="dict-merge"><div class="entry"> <div class="h-g"> <div class="top-container"> <div class="top-g"> <div class="webtop-g"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a> <a class="academic no-href">&nbsp;</a> <span class="z">&nbsp;</span> <h2 class="h">crucial</h2> <span class="z">&nbsp;</span> <a id="5172a69d31db4437b25d5c8bc0460d90"></a><a href="entry://#33c23168dfa54ac9a7c2c8696a777625" class="to-top"><span class="pos">adjective</span></a> </div> <span class="pos-g"><span class="pos">adjective</span></span> <div class="pron-gs ei-g"> <span class="pron-g" geo="br"><span class="prefix">BrE</span> <span class="phon"><span class="bre">BrE</span><span class="separator">/</span><span class="wrap">/</span>ˈkruːʃl<span class="wrap">/</span><span class="separator">/</span></span> <a class="sound audio_play_button pron-uk icon-audio" otitle=" pronunciation English" href="sound://media/english/uk_pron/c/cru/cruci/crucial__gb_1.mp3" type="sound"> &nbsp; </a></span> <span class="sep">;</span> <span class="pron-g" geo="n_am"><span class="prefix">NAmE</span> <span class="phon"><span class="name">NAmE</span><span class="separator">/</span><span class="wrap">/</span>ˈkruːʃl<span class="wrap">/</span><span class="separator">/</span></span> <a class="sound audio_play_button pron-us icon-audio" otitle=" pronunciation American" href="sound://media/english/us_pron/c/cru/cruci/crucial__us_1.mp3" type="sound"> &nbsp; </a></span> </div> <div class="clear"> &nbsp; </div> <br> </div> </div> <span class="sn-gs"><span class="sn-g"><span class="def">extremely important, because it will affect other things</span> <span class="xr-gs"><span class="prefix">synonym</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://critical" otitle="critical definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">critical</span></span></a><span class="sep">,</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://essential" otitle="essential definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">essential</span></span></a></span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">a <span class="cl"><strong>crucial factor/issue/decision</strong></span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">topics of crucial importance</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The next few weeks are going to be crucial.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">crucial</span> to/for something</span> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Winning this contract is crucial to the success of the company.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">crucial</span> that…</span> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x"><span class="cl"><strong>It is crucial that</strong></span> we get this right.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Parents <span class="cl"><strong>play a crucial role</strong></span> in preparing their child for school.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">He wasn't there <span class="cl"><strong>at the crucial moment</strong></span> <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> when he was needed most<span class="wrap">)</span></span>.</span></span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Synonyms"><span class="unbox"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Synonyms</span><span class="body"><span class="h1">essential</span><span class="inline"><span class="li">vital</span> <span class="li">crucial</span> <span class="li">critical</span> <span class="li">decisive</span> <span class="li">indispensable</span></span><span class="p">These words all describe somebody/​something that is extremely important and completely necessary because a particular situation or activity depends on them.</span><span class="deflist"><span class="li"><span class="eb">essential</span> extremely important and completely necessary, because without it something cannot exist, be made or be successful:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Experience is essential for this job.</span></span></span></span></span><span class="li"><span class="eb">vital</span> essential:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The police play a vital role in our society.</span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="h3">essential or vital?</span><span class="p">These words have the same meaning but there can be a slight difference in tone. <span class="eb">Essential</span> is used to state a fact or opinion with authority. <span class="eb">Vital</span> is often used when there is some anxiety felt about something, or a need to persuade somebody that a fact or opinion is true, right or important. <span class="eb">Vital</span> is less often used in negative statements:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">It was vital to show that he was not afraid.</span></span></span> <span class="x-g"><span class="wx">Money is not vital to happiness.</span></span></span></span><span class="deflist"><span class="li"><span class="eb">crucial</span> extremely important because a particular situation or activity depends on it:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">It is crucial that we get this right.</span></span></span></span></span><span class="li"><span class="eb">critical</span> extremely important because a particular situation or activity depends on it:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Your decision is critical to our future.</span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="h3">crucial or critical?</span><span class="p">These words have the same meaning but there can be a slight difference in context. <span class="eb">Critical</span> is often used in technical matters of business or science; <span class="eb">crucial</span> is often used to talk about matters that may cause anxiety or other emotions.</span><span class="deflist"><span class="li"><span class="eb">decisive</span> of the greatest importance in affecting the final result of a particular situation:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">She has played a decisive role in the peace negotiations.</span></span></span></span></span><span class="li"><span class="eb">indispensable</span> essential; too important to be without:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Cars have become an indispensable part of our lives.</span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="h3">Patterns</span><span class="bullet"><span class="li"> essential/​vital/​crucial/​critical/​decisive/​indispensable <span class="eb">for</span> something</span><span class="li"> essential/​vital/​crucial/​critical/​indispensable <span class="eb">to</span> something</span><span class="li"> essential/​vital/​crucial/​critical <span class="eb">that…</span></span><span class="li"> essential/​vital/​crucial/​critical <span class="eb">to do something</span></span><span class="li"> a(n) essential/​vital/​crucial/​critical/​decisive/​indispensable <span class="eb">part/​factor</span></span><span class="li"> <span class="eb">of</span> vital/​crucial/​critical/​decisive <span class="eb">importance</span></span><span class="li"> <span class="eb">absolutely</span> essential/​vital/​crucial/​critical/​decisive/​indispensable</span></span></span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Language Bank"><span class="unbox"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Language Bank</span><span class="body"><span class="h1">emphasis</span><span class="h2">Highlighting an important point</span><span class="bullet"><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">This case <span class="eb">emphasizes</span>/<span class="eb">highlights</span> the importance of honest communication between managers and employees.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">Effective communication skills are <span class="eb">essential</span>/<span class="eb">crucial</span>/<span class="eb">vital</span>.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x"><span class="eb">It should be noted that</span> this study considers only verbal communication. Non-verbal communication is not dealt with here.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x"><span class="eb">It is important to remember that</span>/<span class="eb">An important point to remember is that</span> non-verbal communication plays a key role in getting your message across.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">Communication is not only about the words you use but also your body language and, <span class="eb">especially</span>/<span class="eb">above all</span>, the effectiveness with which you listen.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">I would like to <span class="eb">draw attention to</span> the role of listening in effective communication.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">Choose your words carefully: <span class="eb">in particular</span>, avoid confusing and ambiguous language.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">Finally, and perhaps <span class="eb">most importantly</span>, you must learn to listen as well as to speak.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Language Bank"><span class="unbox"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Language Bank</span><span class="body"><span class="h1">vital</span><span class="h2">Saying that something is necessary</span><span class="bullet"><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x"><span class="eb">It is vital that</span> journalists can verify the accuracy of their reports.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">Journalists play a <span class="eb">vital</span>/<span class="eb">crucial</span> role in educating the public.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">Public trust is a <span class="eb">crucial</span> issue for all news organizations.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">The ability to write well is <span class="eb">essential</span> for any journalist.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">The Internet has become an <span class="eb">indispensable</span> tool for reporters.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">In journalism, accuracy is <span class="eb">paramount</span>/…is <span class="eb">of paramount importance</span>.</span></span></span></span><span class="li"> <span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x"><span class="eb">It is imperative that</span> journalists maintain the highest possible standards of reporting.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> <span class="res-g"><span class="collapse" otitle="Word Origin"><span class="unbox is-active"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"> <span class="def">early 18th cent.</span> (in the sense <span class="qt">‘cross-shaped’</span>): from <span class="lang">French</span>, from <span class="lang">Latin</span> <span class="ff">crux</span>, <span class="ff">cruc-</span> ‘cross’. The sense <span class="qt">‘decisive’</span> is from Francis Bacon's <span class="lang">Latin phrase</span> <span class="ff">instantia crucis</span> ‘crucial instance’, which he explained as a metaphor from a <span class="ff">crux</span> or fingerpost marking a fork at a crossroad; Newton and Boyle took up the metaphor in <span class="ff">experimentum crucis</span> ‘crucial experiment’.</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Extra examples</span><span class="body"><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Secrecy is crucial to this police operation.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The talks are crucial for the success of the plan.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">A crucial factor affecting educational performance is the competence of the teacher.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Getting these procedures right is of crucial importance.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He wasn’t there at the crucial moment.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">It is crucial that we get this right.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Winning this contract is absolutely crucial to our long term success.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span> </div> </div></div></html>
dirigisme	But dirigisme disguised as a helping kind could have dangerous consequences: better to focus on insisting that governments must not skew their bail-outs toward fossil fuels.	<html><style
