</div> </div> <span class="sn-gs"><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#fc5b62263448421694f75e7f5a95f429" class="sen"></a><span class="num">1</span><span class="def">to change your appearance so that people cannot recognize you</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">disguise</span> somebody</span> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The hijackers were heavily disguised.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">disguise</span> somebody as somebody/something</span> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">They got in disguised as security guards.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">disguise</span> yourself (as somebody/something)</span> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">She disguised herself as a boy.</span></span></span></span></li><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#fc5b62263448421694f75e7f5a95f429" class="sen"></a><span class="num">2</span><span class="cf"><span class="exp">disguise</span> something</span> <span class="def">to hide something or change it, so that it cannot be recognized</span> <span class="xr-gs"><span class="prefix">synonym</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://conceal" otitle="conceal definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">conceal</span></span></a></span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">She made no attempt to disguise her surprise.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">It was a <span class="cl"><strong>thinly disguised</strong></span> attack on the President.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">She couldn't <span class="cl"><strong>disguise the fact that</strong></span> she felt uncomfortable.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">He tried to disguise his accent.</span></span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Synonyms"><span class="unbox"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Synonyms</span><span class="body"><span class="h1">hide</span><span class="inline"><span class="li">conceal</span> <span class="li">cover</span> <span class="li">disguise</span> <span class="li">mask</span> <span class="li">camouflage</span></span><span class="p">These words all mean to put or keep somebody/​something in a place where they/​it cannot be seen or found, or to keep the truth or your feelings secret.</span><span class="deflist"><span class="li"><span class="eb">hide</span> to put or keep somebody/​something in a place where they/​it cannot be seen or found; to keep something secret, especially your feelings:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">He hid the letter in a drawer.</span></span></span> <span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">She managed to hide her disappointment.</span></span></span></span></span><span class="li"><span class="eb">conceal</span> (<span class="ei">formal</span>) to hide somebody/​something; to keep something secret:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The paintings were concealed beneath a thick layer of plaster.</span></span></span> <span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Tim could barely conceal his disappointment.</span></span></span></span> <span class="un">When it is being used to talk about emotions, <span class="eb">conceal</span> is often used in negative statements. </span></span><span class="li"><span class="eb">cover</span> to place something over or in front of something in order to hide it:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">She covered her face with her hands.</span></span></span></span></span><span class="li"><span class="eb">disguise</span> to hide or change the nature of something, so that it cannot be recognized:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">He tried to disguise his accent.</span></span></span></span></span><span class="li"><span class="eb">mask</span> to hide a feeling, smell, fact, etc. so that it cannot be easily seen or noticed:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">She masked her anger with a smile.</span></span></span></span></span><span class="li"><span class="eb">camouflage</span> to hide somebody/​something by making them/​it look like the things around, or like something else:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The soldiers camouflaged themselves with leaves and twigs.</span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="h3">Patterns</span><span class="bullet"><span class="li"> to hide/​conceal/​disguise/​mask/​camouflage something <span class="eb">behind</span> something</span><span class="li"> to hide/​conceal something <span class="eb">under</span> something</span><span class="li"> to hide/​conceal something <span class="eb">from</span> somebody</span><span class="li"> to hide/​conceal/​disguise/​mask <span class="eb">the truth/​the fact that…</span></span><span class="li"> to hide/​conceal/​disguise/​mask <span class="eb">your feelings</span></span></span></span></span></span></li></span> <span class="res-g"><span class="collapse" otitle="Word Origin"><span class="unbox is-active"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Middle English</span></span> (meaning <span class="qt">‘change one's usual style of dress’</span>, with no implication of concealing one's identity): from <span class="lang">Old French</span> <span class="ff">desguisier</span>.</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Extra examples</span><span class="body"><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He made no attempt to disguise his liking for her.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He spoke in a heavily disguised voice.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He was disguised as a police officer.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">In her speech she made several thinly disguised attacks on the president.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">She tried to disguise the fact that she was pregnant.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">She was cleverly disguised as a policewoman.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">You cannot disguise what you are doing from your family.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">She couldn’t disguise the fact that she felt uncomfortable.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span> </ol> </div><div class="entry"> <ol href="entry://#0a9db51c48b94ef5895ce2f43068eecb" class="sen"></a><span class="num">1 </span><span class="sym_first"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a></span><span class="def">a thing that helps you to be better or more successful than other people</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">a <span class="cl"><strong>big/great/definite advantage</strong></span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">an unfair advantage <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> something that benefits you, but not your opponents<span class="wrap">)</span></span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">She <span class="cl"><strong>had the advantage of</strong></span> a good education.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">You will <span class="cl"><strong>be at an advantage</strong></span> <span class="gl"><span class="wrap">(</span><span class="prefix">=</span> have an advantage<span class="wrap">)</span></span> in the interview if you have thought about the questions in advance.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">advantage</span> over somebody</span> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Being tall gave him an advantage over the other players.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">companies seeking competitive advantage over their trading rivals</span></span></span> <span class="xr-gs"><span class="prefix">opposite</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://disadvantage" otitle="disadvantage definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="xh">disadvantage</span></span></a></span></li><li class="sn-g" ox3000="y"><a href="entry://#0a9db51c48b94ef5895ce2f43068eecb" class="sen"></a><span class="num">2 </span><span class="sym_first"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a></span><span class="def">a quality of something that makes it better or more useful</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">A small car <span class="cl"><strong>has the</strong></span> added <span class="cl"><strong>advantage of</strong></span> being cheaper to run.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">One advantage of/One of the advantages of living in the country is the fresh air.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Each of these systems has its advantages and disadvantages.</span></span></span></span> <span class="xr-gs"><span class="prefix">opposite</span> <a class="Ref" href="entry://disadvantage" otitle="disadvantage definition"><span class="xr-g"><span class="ndv">tennis</span></span><span class="wrap">)</span></span> <span class="def">the first point scored after a score of 40–40.</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Advantage Murray.</span></span></span></span> </li></span> <span class="res-g"><span class="collapse" otitle="Word Origin"><span class="unbox is-active"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Middle English</span></span>: from <span class="lang">Old French</span> <span class="ff">avantage</span>, from <span class="ff">avant</span> ‘in front’, from <span class="lang">late Latin</span> <span class="ff">abante</span> ‘in front’, from <span class="ff">ab</span> ‘from’ + <span class="ff">ante</span> ‘before’. The initial <span class="etym_i">a-</span> was mistakenly assimilated to <span class="etym_i">ad-</span> in the 16th cent.</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Extra examples</span><span class="body"><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Breastfeeding offers a clear advantage to your baby.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">East coast resorts have the advantage over west coast ones.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He would gain considerable advantage from staying in that job.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">I took complete advantage of the situation.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">It is to your advantage to delay things for as long as possible.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The bright lighting showed the jewels to their best advantage.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The commanders were anxious to press home their advantage with a further offensive in the north.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The company has an unfair advantage over its competitors.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The company was able to gain a competitive advantage over its rivals by reducing costs.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The new design gives us a clear advantage over our competitors.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The plan would be to our mutual advantage.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">There may be some advantage in laying down a clearer procedure.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">These computers have the added advantage of being cheap.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">They argue that the possible risks attached to such vaccines vastly outweigh any advantages.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">the advantage to both countries of closer economic ties</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">the natural advantages of a fertile soil</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">the natural advantages of countries with low labour costs</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Being tall gave him a definite advantage over the other players.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Having a degree is a huge advantage when it comes to getting a job.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Is there any advantage in getting there early?</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">The bill will give US tuna processors a competitive advantage in the US tuna market.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Their better training gave the French troops a decisive advantage.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">They took an early lead and held onto their advantage right to the end.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">With good cooperation we should be able to exploit this opportunity to our mutual advantage.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">You will be at an advantage if you have thought about the interview questions in advance.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span> <span class="idm-gs"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else Origin</span><span class="body"> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Middle English</span></span>: from <span class="lang">Old French</span> <span class="ff">avantage</span>, from <span class="ff">avant</span> ‘in front’, from <span class="lang">late Latin</span> <span class="ff">abante</span> ‘in front’, from <span class="ff">ab</span> ‘from’ + <span class="ff">ante</span> ‘before’. scornful	And with China’s leadership focused only on its own advantage and America’s as scornful of the World Health Organisation as it is of the Paris climate agreement, neither calamity is getting the co-ordinated international response it deserves.	<html><style type="text/css">*{word-wrap:break-word !important}body{color:#000;font-family:"Lucida Grande","Open Sans","Lucida Sans cherished	Take carbon-pricing first. Long cherished by the economists, such schemes use the power of market to incentivise consumers and firms to cut their emissions, thus ensuring that the shift from carbon happens in the most effective <div class="clear"> &nbsp; </div> <br> </div> </div> <span class="sn-gs"><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#ec795aa0a3ad4901a7c7d498b89d5593" class="sen"></a><span class="num">1</span><span class="cf"><span class="exp">cherish</span> somebody/something</span> <span class="def">to love somebody/something very much and want to protect them or it</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Children need to be cherished.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">her <span class="cl"><strong>most cherished possession</strong></span></span></span></span> </li><li class="sn-g"><a href="entry://#ec795aa0a3ad4901a7c7d498b89d5593" class="sen"></a><span class="num">2</span><span class="cf"><span class="exp">cherish</span> something</span> <span class="def">to keep an idea, a hope or a pleasant feeling in your mind for a long time</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x"><span class="cl"><strong>Cherish the memory</strong></span> of those days in Paris.</span></span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">He cherishes the hope that one day they will meet again.</span></span></span></span></li></span> <span class="res-g"><span class="collapse" otitle="Word Origin"><span class="unbox is-active"> <span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Middle English</span></span> (in the sense <span class="qt">‘treat with affection’</span>): from <span class="lang">Old French</span> <span class="ff">cheriss-</span>, lengthened stem of <span class="ff">cherir</span>, from <span class="ff">cher</span> ‘dear’, from <span class="lang">Latin</span> <span class="ff">carus</span>.</span></span></span></span> </ol> </div></div></html>
incentivise	Take carbon-pricing first. Long cherished by the economists, such schemes use the power of market to incentivise consumers and firms to cut their emissions, thus ensuring that the shift from carbon happens in the most effective way possible.	can not find definitions
shift	Take carbon-pricing first. Origin</span><span class="body"> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Old English</span></span> <span class="etym_i">sciftan</span> <span class="qt">‘arrange, divide, share’</span>, of <span class="lang">Germanic</span> origin; related to <span class="lang">German</span> <span class="ff">schichten</span> ‘to layer’. A common <span class="def"><span class="lang">Middle English</span></span> sense <span class="qt">‘change, replace’</span> gave rise to the noun <span class="xg">senses <span class="xs"><span class="wrap">(</span>5<span class="wrap">)</span></span> and <span class="xs"><span class="wrap">(</span>6<span class="wrap">)</span></span></span> (via the sense of <span class="qt">‘changing one's clothes’</span>) and <span class="xg">senses <span class="xs"><span class="wrap">(</span>2<span class="wrap">)</span></span> and <span class="xs"><span class="wrap">(</span>3<span class="wrap">)</span></span></span> (via the sense of <span class="qt">‘relays of workers’</span>).</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Old English</span></span> <span class="etym_i">sciftan</span> <span class="qt">‘arrange, divide, share’</span>, of <span class="lang">Germanic</span> origin; related to <span class="lang">German</span> <span class="ff">schichten</span> ‘to layer’. A common <span class="def"><span class="lang">Middle English</span></span> sense <span class="qt">‘change, replace’</span> gave rise to the noun <span class="xg">senses <span class="xs"><span class="wrap">(</span>5<span class="wrap">)</span></span> and <span class="xs"><span class="wrap">(</span>6<span class="wrap">)</span></span></span> (via the sense of <span class="qt">‘changing one's clothes’</span>) and <span class="xg">senses <span class="xs"><span class="wrap">(</span>2<span class="wrap">)</span></span> and <span class="xs"><span class="wrap">(</span>3<span class="wrap">)</span></span></span> (via the sense of <span class="qt">‘relays of workers’</span>).</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span <span class="x">I agreed to work double shifts for a few weeks.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">I detected a subtle shift towards our point of view.</span></span><span class="x-g"> enact	But as we explain this week the pandemic both reveals the size of the challenge ahead and also creates a unique chance to enact government policies that steer the economy away from carbon at a lower financial, social and political cost than might otherwise have been the case. 	<html><style type="text/css">*{word-wrap:break-word !important}body{color:#000;font-family:"Lucida Grande","Open onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Which Word?</span><span class="body"><span class="h1">at the back / at the rear / behind</span><span class="bullet"><span class="li"> <span class="eb">At the back</span> and <span class="eb">at the rear</span> have a similar meaning, but <span class="eb">at the rear</span> is used more in formal or official language:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">What’s that at the back of the fridge?</span></span></span> <span class="x-g"><span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Smoking is only allowed at the rear of the aircraft.</span></span></span></span> It is more usual to talk about the <span class="eb">back door</span> of a house but the <span class="eb">rear exit</span> of an aircraft or public building. If something is <span class="eb">behind</span> something else it is near to the back of it but not part of it. Compare:<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">Our room was at the back of the hotel</span></span></span> and<span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"><span class="x">There’s a lovely wood just behind our hotel</span></span></span>.</span></span></span></span></span></li></span> <span class="sn-gs"> <span class="shcut">of piece of paper</span><li class="sn-g" ox3000="y"><a href="entry://#268c057ca7ab4ff0bbf6f6585e246110" class="sen"></a><span class="num">4 </span><span class="sym_first"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a></span><span class="gram-g"><span class="wrap">[</span><span class="gram">usually singular</span><span class="wrap">]</span></span> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">back</span> (of something)</span> <span class="def">the part of a piece of paper, etc. that is on the opposite side to the one that has information or the most important information on it</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">Write your name on the back of the cheque.</span></span></span></span></li></span> <span class="sn-gs"> <span class="shcut">of book</span><li class="sn-g" ox3000="y"><a href="entry://#268c057ca7ab4ff0bbf6f6585e246110" class="sen"></a><span class="num">5 </span><span class="sym_first"> <a class="oxford3000 no-href">&nbsp;</a></span><span class="gram-g"><span class="wrap">[</span><span class="gram">usually singular</span><span class="wrap">]</span></span> <span class="cf"><span class="exp">back</span> (of something)</span> <span class="def">the last few pages of a book, etc.</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">The television guide is at the back of the paper.</span></span></span></span></li></span> <span Origin</span><span class="body"> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Old English</span></span> <span class="etym_i">bæc</span>, of <span class="lang">Germanic</span> origin; related to <span class="lang">Middle Dutch</span> and <span class="lang">Old Norse</span> <span class="ff">bak</span>. The adverb use dates from <span class="def"><span class="lang">late Middle English</span></span> and is a shortening of <span class="xr"><span class="xh">aback</span></span>.</span></span></span><span class="collapse" otitle="Extra examples"><span class="unbox"><span class="heading" onclick="if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox'){this.parentNode.className='unbox is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Extra examples</span><span class="body"><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">Come around back and I’ll show you the pool.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He hunches his back when he walks.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He leaned his back against the bar.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He smiled and gave me a hearty slap on the back.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He spent six months recovering from a broken back.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He was carrying a small child on his back.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He was standing with his back to the fire.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He yawned and stretched his back as he got out of bed.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">He’s in bed with a bad back.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">His back stiffened as he saw the photographers waiting.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">I had my pullover on back to back.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">I was flat on my back for six weeks when I broke my leg.</span></span><span class="x-g"> <span class="x">If you’d like to come round the back, is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Idioms</span> <span class="idm-g"> <div class="top-container"> <div class="top-g"> <span class="idm">at/in the back of your mind</span> <div class="clear"> &nbsp; </div> <br> </div> </div><span class="sn-gs"><span class="sn-g"><span class="def">if a thought, etc. is <span class="eb">at the back of your mind</span>, you are aware of it but it is not what you are mainly thinking about</span><span class="x-gs"><span class="x-g"> <span class="rx-g"><span class="x">At the back of my mind was a small, warning voice, telling me it was is-active';}else if(this.parentNode.className=='unbox is-active'){this.parentNode.className='unbox';}">Word Origin</span><span class="body"> <span class="def"><span class="lang">Old English</span></span> <span class="etym_i">bæc</span>, of <span class="lang">Germanic</span> origin; related to <span class="lang">Middle Dutch</span> and <span class="lang">Old Norse</span> <span class="ff">bak</span>. The adverb use dates from <span class="def"><span class="lang">late Middle English</span></span> and is a shortening of <span class="xr"><span class="xh">aback</span></span>.</span></span></span><span
